PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Social Networks and Clustering Using Partitioning technique
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: I worked with an M.Tech senior and actively took part in the programming aspect of the clustering of given points. The purpose of the project was to efficiently cluster a given graph, that is to group similar nodes of the graph together and separate from the other nodes. Similarity was determined based on mathematical formulae. Implementation was done in C.

Currently pursuing a research based project along with our  Head Of the Department (CSE Heritage Institute Of Technology ) on Hypercubes and maximal matchings. The aim of the paper is to prove that the range of matched edges in a maximal matching in a Hypercube of order n is from 3*2^(n-3) to 2^(n-1). We have been able to prove that the lower bound for the number of matched edges is at least 8/9 of our intended value of 3*2^(n-3)

HONOR & AWARD.Title: Speaker at the JQuery Conference, 2015, Bangalore
